p: A solution of p-, m-, or o- hydroxybenzaldehyde (6.75 mmol) in EtOH (11.4 ml) and the proper oxyamine 42 or 43 (6.75 mmol) was refluxed for 12 h. After cooling, the mixture was evaporated. The crude was dissolved in a mixture of MeOH/EtOH 3:7 (20 ml) and treated with 1.2 equivalent of the proper organic acid (oxalic, malic or fumaric acids) affording the amino alcohols ( 14– 16, 70–80% yields) as white solids after crystallisation from MeOH/Et 2O.
